    • Method Detail

      • startSession

        public void startSession()
                  throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Starts a repository session. All calls to set or get methods should happen within sessions. Only one session is needed / possible.
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException

      • endSession

        public void endSession()
                throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Ends the current session - only one session is needed / possible
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Closes all open session - not really necessary if you remember to end the session you opened.

      • setOriginalContent

        public void setOriginalContent(java.net.URL url,
                      java.lang.String content)
                        throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Stores the string content for the URL. Sets the modification date to "now"
        Parameters:
        url - The urls thar was used to retrieve "content"
        content - The string content of the document (html)
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException

      • setExtractedContent

        public void setExtractedContent(java.net.URL url,
                       java.lang.String extractedContent,
                       java.lang.String extractor)
                         throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Stores the string content that an extractor gave us for the url. It is up to the caller to get the content of the url, call the extractor and then call this method. It is also up to the caller to make sure the format of the extracted content is known (i.e., rdf, n3, json)
        Parameters:
        url - The url of the original document that the extractor extracted to give us extractedContent
        extractedContent -
        extractor - URL as a String for the extractor / or any other id
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException
